page.title: 13BUDDO ROCK
page.content: Along this part of coastline a prominent stack of rock,called{Buddo {Rock}is situated.It is made of sandstone and was once part of the cliffs behind.Being of a harder material it is more resistant to erosion.There has been the formation of a natural arch giving its distinctive appearance.Beyond this rock a cattle shed stands which used to be the old lifeboat station built between 1860 and 1890,now open on the landward side,while from the shore side a lifeboat could be launched.Not far from the cattle shed a track leads up towards Chesterfield Farm and then onto Boarhills village passing a rectangular dovecot.Further along this piece of coastline there is a 3 to 4 metre high wall built to prevent erosion by the sea.
